prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Continuum band-4
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Mosaic mapping of the target sources in the 3.2 mm dust continuum, which are proposed to measure the gas morphology and filament structures.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: Based on the previous results, the region has a H2 column density variation 10^25 to 5*10^23 cm^-2 for the relatively weak region. In order to significantly detect the dust emission associated with such N(H2) at average temperature of ~20 K, it requires an rms level of 0.2 mJy beam^-1 at 3.2 mm (band 3) and 0.3 mJy beam^-2 at 2.0 mm (band 4).
The major purpose is to detect the dust emission in the cores and filaments. The correlators are arranged in the standard manner for the continuum observation in band-3.

Our major purpose is to investigate the detailed filament structures. Based on the previous VLA observation, a 3-arcsec resolution can guarentee that the cores can be well identified and resolved from the vicinity gas structures. The large-scale gas structures may exist, but are not closely related with our science goals. The ACA array is thus not required currently.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Continuum band-3
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Mosaic mapping of the target sources in the 3.2 mm dust continuum, which are proposed to measure the gas morphology and filament structures.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: Based on the previous results, the region has a H2 column density variation 10^25 to 5*10^23 cm^-2 for the relatively weak region. In order to significantly detect the dust emission associated with such N(H2) at average temperature of ~20 K, it requires an rms level of 0.2 mJy beam^-1 at 3.2 mm (band 3) and 0.3 mJy beam^-2 at 2.0 mm (band 4).
The major purpose is to detect the dust emission in the cores and filaments. The correlators are arranged in the standard manner for the continuum observation in band-3.

Our major purpose is to investigate the detailed filament structures. Based on the previous VLA observation, a 3-arcsec resolution can guarentee that the cores can be well identified and resolved from the vicinity gas structures. The large-scale gas structures may exist, but are not closely related with our science goals. The ACA array is thus not required currently.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: molecular-line mapping
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Mosaic mapping of the OMC-1,2,4 regions. The frequency setup is to cover N2H+ (1-0) (93.1734 GHz) HC3N (10-9) (90.977 GHz), and CH3CN (91.9871 GHz), For the OMC-1 observation, we propose to include the Orion central cluster, in order to obatin a complete gas structure from the central dense region to the northern filament. The combined data would yield the full Orion filament in a uniform setting with obvious legacy and publicity value as well.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Our previous VLA observations (Li et al. 2013, beam=5") revealed NH3 gas clumps with typical extent of 10 arcsec and line width usually less than 2 km/s. Nakamura et al. (2014) observed another nearby low-mass star-forming filament Serpens south in CCS (4-3) and found a typical Tb~1.0 K. We expect an intensity rms of 0.18 K and velocity resolution of 0.2 km/s and. The HC3N and CH3CN lines are mainly used to derive the temperature, their velocity resolutions are thus loosened to reduce the data rate. The dense cores with the clumps are expected to have size of ~5 arcsec. In the ALMA observation, in order to improve resolution and maintain a reasonable integration time (<10 hours) at the same time, a beam=3" seems to be an optimized choice.
At the time of the submission (ten minutes before the deadline), we only see two of the 11 requested SBs on OMC-2 from a Cycle-2 C proposal in ALMA archive with "in progress" status, which means that it has not passed QA2 yet. Accordlingly, we don't have duplication by the definition in the AO. Still, to maximize the potential science return of this program, we have taken steps in writing this proposal to avoid overlap in spatial coverage.

The major purpose is to detected individual molecular lines in the prestellar cores. The molecular lines are expected to have narrow line width (<2 km/s), and have no complicated components with broad velocity range. We thus adopt the narrowest window frequency range that can reduce the data rate.

Our major purpose is to investigate individual pre-stellar cores. Based on the previous VLA observation, a 3-arcsec resolution can guarentee that the cores can be well identified and resolved from the vicinity gas structures. The large-scale gas structures may exist, but are not closely related with our science goals.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: We propose to map the massive quiescent filament in Orion in the dense molecular tracers HC3N, CH3CN, and N2H+, aiming to reveal the detailed structure and kinematic features, helping to understanding several fundamental properties and characters of the filament structures and there roles in mass aggregation and initiating the star formation.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:previousProposals: 2013.1.00662.S, "Resolving the Dynamical Structures of Filaments and Cores in Orion Down to Jeans Scale", Diego Mardones (note. At the time of the submission (a couple of hours before the deadline), we only see one SB from a cycle-2 C proposal in ALMA archive with "in progress" status, which means that it has not passed quality check yet. Accordlingly, we don't have duplication by the definition in the AO. Still, to maximize the potential science return of this program, we have taken steps in writing this proposal to avoid overlap in spatial coverage.)
